body:
The Claim for costs of a child’s funeral online form puts small files (known as ‘cookies’) onto your computer to collect information about how you browse the site.

Cookies are used to:

- remember your progress
- measure how you use the website so it can be updated and improved based on your needs

Claim for costs of a child’s funeral cookies aren't used to identify you personally.

You'll normally see a message on the site before we store a cookie on your computer.

Find out more about [how to manage cookies](https://www.aboutcookies.org/).

## How cookies are used on Claim for costs of a child’s funeral

You may see a pop-up welcome message when you first visit Claim for costs of a child’s funeral. We'll store a cookie so that your computer knows you've seen it and knows not to show it again.

| Name | Purpose | Expires | 
|---|---|---|
| seen_cookie_message | Saves a message to let us know that you've seen our cookie message | 1 month |

## Remembering your progress

We will store a cookie to remember your application progress in this computer and to expire your session after 30 minutes of inactivity or when you close your browser.

| Name | Purpose | Expires | 
|---|---|---|
| _sessionId | Saves your current progress in this computer and tracks inactivity periods | After 30 minutes of inactivity or when you close your browser |

## Measuring website usage (Google Analytics)

We use Google Analytics software to collect information about how you use Claim for costs of a child’s funeral. We do this to help make sure the online form is meeting the needs of its users and to help us make improvements.
Google Analytics stores information about:

- the pages you visit
- how long you spend on each page 
- how you got to the site
- what you click on while you’re visiting the site

We don't collect or store your personal information (for example your name or address) so this information can't be used to identify who you are.

We don’t allow Google to use or share our analytics data.

Google Analytics sets the following cookies:

### Universal Analytics

| Name | Purpose | Expires | 
|---|---|---|
| _ga | This helps us count how many people visit Claim for costs of a child’s funeral by tracking if you've visited before | 2 years |
| _gid | This helps us count how many people visit Claim for costs of a child’s funeral by tracking if you've visited before | 24 hours |
| _gat | Used to manage the rate at which page view requests are made | 10 minutes |

### Google Analytics

| Name | Purpose | Expires | 
|---|---|---|
| _utma | Like _ga, this lets us know if you've visited before, so we can count how many of our visitors are new to Claim for costs of a child’s funeral or to a certain page | 2 years |
| _utmb | This works with _utmc to calculate the average length of time you spend on Claim for costs of a child’s funeral | 30 minutes |
| _utmc | This works with _utmb to calculate when you close your browser | when you close your browser |
| _utmz | This tells us how you reached Claim for costs of a child’s funeral (for example from another website or a search engine)  | 6 months |

You can [opt out of Google Analytics cookies](https://tools.google.com/dlpage/gaoptout).
heading: Cookies
